evidence_items.text: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle. The airfield boundary fence in the Rwy 07 undershoot had also sustained damage. The barbed wire support arm on one fence pole was missing and the wire had been severed in that location.

Safety reporting With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024. In the MOR, the event type was recorded as ‘ Incident.’ Following a review of the report, ASSI reclassified the event as a Serious Incident and notified the AAIB on 6 January 2025.

Unaware that the aircraft had struck any obstacles on the approach, the flight crew did not submit a safety report about the landing but provided the following brief statement on 8 November 2024 in response to the TUPJ airfield authorities’ enquiries.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’ Although they were requested from the commander, further details of the occurrence, which could have provided greater insight into the content and context of their 8 November statement, were not provided to the AAIB.

ICAO Annex (Aircraft Accident and Incident Investigation) Attachment C lists typical examples of incidents that are likely to be classified as serious. This list includes: ‘Take-off or landing incidents. Incidents such as under-shooting, overrunning or running off the side of runways.’ The operator did not instigate an internal safety review for this serious incident.
Personnel The commander did not supply the investigation with details of their flight licence, medical status, flying experience or recency.

Meteorology The reports submitted to the AAIB did not contain meteorological information, but the UK Met Office generated a limited aftercast for the time of the serious incident. The report found that: ● The weather conditions on the day were characterised by light east to north easterly winds with scattered cloud.
● The TUPJ TAF included a risk of thunderstorms from 1800 hrs UTC, with an associated forecast reduction in visibility and cloud bases.

● The reported intensity of the rainfall at the airfield along with the number of lightning strikes recorded on the weather radar imagery at indicated an active CB cell was over or close to the territory at the time of the serious incident.
● There was no indication of any significant wind shear in association with the thunderstorms, but the Met Office did not have access to the full record of wind speed or direction.

Weather radar image at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November 2024 (crosses indicate lightning strikes) Aircraft examination The flight crew did not notice any aircraft damage on the turnaround at TUPJ. During maintenance action after the return flight ‘marks of contact’ were found on the left mainwheel tyre which required it to be removed and replaced. The operator did not identify any other airframe damage.
The runway chart for TUPJ alerts pilots to occasional windshear on the approach to Rwy 07 when the winds are from the south and south-east.

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. It then bounced and touched down again close to the threshold.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report. The aircraft returned to its home base approximately one hour later.

node.statement: Communication/coordination breakdown among crew occurred in the context of Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal.

assumptions: Absence of evidence of communication breakdown implies it did not occur or was not detected.
defeaters: If evidence showed crew discussions or reports indicating miscommunication or coordination failures during the approach or landing.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items indicates any communication or coordination breakdown among the crew during the incident; all reports focus on the aircraft undershoot, weather, and damage without mentioning crew communication issues.

node.statement: Mechanical/control failure occurred in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal dataset.

assumptions: No mechanical/control failure is reported or implied in the provided evidence.
defeaters: Evidence of mechanical or control system malfunction in the aircraft during the event.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence indicates that a mechanical or control failure occurred; all evidence points to an undershoot caused by weather and pilot response without mechanical issues (H1-H12, S1-S3).

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency is present in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal dataset.

assumptions: The dataset 'Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal' includes the time and location of the incident described.
defeaters: If evidence showed the light was removed for maintenance unrelated to the incident or was not present at the time of the dataset, confidence would decrease.

The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence from H1 and S2 confirms the presence of an environmental or marking deficiency (missing/damaged frangible light) in the dataset scope.
outcome.uncertainty_source: No explicit timestamp linking the deficiency exactly to the dataset time, but the event is contemporaneous with the dataset scope.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is documented and available in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal dataset.

defeaters: If the dataset included explicit documentation or records of pushback procedural deviations, or if the evidence explicitly linked the incident to pushback execution errors.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided dataset explicitly documents or makes available a procedural deviation in pushback execution; the evidence focuses on a landing undershoot incident and related damage, not pushback procedures.

node.statement: The environmental or marking deficiency aligns with the key features identified in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal dataset.

defeaters: If evidence showed the damage was caused by something other than the aircraft undershoot or unrelated environmental factors.
If the environmental conditions or marking deficiencies did not match the key features in the dataset.

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to  arrest the descent�, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold.

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence directly shows that the environmental condition (downdraught) and the aircraft undershoot caused damage to a frangible light at the runway undershoot area, aligning with the key features of the dataset (H1, S2, S1).
outcome.uncertainty_source: No significant uncertainty as the evidence clearly links the environmental conditions and marking deficiency to the key features.

node.statement: The identification of the environmental or marking deficiency in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal dataset is robust against potential defeaters or counter-evidence.

assumptions: The tyre marks and damage were correctly attributed to the aircraft
No other unreported events caused the damage
The official incident classification reflects accurate assessment
defeaters: Additional evidence showing alternative causes for the damage (e.g., ground vehicle) or errors in identifying the marks as aircraft-related
New meteorological data indicating no environmental factors contributed
Flight crew or maintenance reports contradicting the damage or undershoot

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing. Tyre marks were also discovered on the extreme end of the runway. Based on the nature of the marks, their orientation and location, as well as the track between them, it was determined they were made by an aircraft rather than a ground vehicle.

Safety reporting With damage to airfield infrastructure having been found, the airfield duty manager submitted a Mandatory Occurrence Report (MOR) to Air Safety Support International (ASSI) on 9 November 2024. In the MOR, the event type was recorded as ‘ Incident.’ Following a review of the report, ASSI reclassified the event as a Serious Incident and notified the AAIB on 6 January 2025.

‘On November 6 the weather was marginal with rain on all quadrants, upon approaching runway 7 on short final started to experience wind gusts and probably a downdraft [sic], seemed close to a low-level wind shear. Applied power to arrest the descent. I landed slightly short of the numbers. I was totally unaware that I struck [anything].’

On arrival at Terrance B Lettsome International Airport (TUPJ) in the British Virgin Islands, N915GD was likely affected by nearby thunderstorm activity, reportedly experiencing a downdraught on short finals. Despite the commander applying more power to “arrest the descent”, the aircraft initially touched down on the lip of Runway (Rwy 07), approximately 150 m short of the threshold. outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence directly documents the environmental and marking deficiencies (missing frangible light, tyre marks, fence damage) and confirms the aircraft undershot the runway, striking the light (H1, S2). The commander’s unawareness and lack of reporting (H4, S3) do not undermine the physical evidence. The incident was officially classified as serious (H2), supporting robustness against counter-evidence.
outcome.uncertainty_source: Some ambiguity exists due to lack of detailed flight crew reports and incomplete meteorological data, but physical evidence and official classification mitigate this.

node.statement: The mechanical/control failure aligns with the key features observed in the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal scope.

defeaters: Evidence of mechanical or control system malfunction during the approach or landing
Maintenance or flight data indicating control anomalies
Pilot reports or sensor data confirming control failure

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution aligns with the key features identified for Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal, reflecting relevant operational characteristics.

assumptions: The key features for Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal include undershoot and damage to runway infrastructure as described.
The procedural deviation refers to the undershoot and related aircraft actions during pushback execution.
defeaters: If evidence showed the procedural deviation did not match known key features or operational characteristics for this aircraft and event.
If additional data indicated the damage was caused by a ground vehicle or other non-aircraft source.
If the commander or operator had provided detailed procedural reports contradicting the alignment.

node.statement: The procedural deviation in pushback execution withstands potential defeaters and remains valid within the context of Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal.

defeaters: If additional evidence showed the deviation was justified or mitigated by external factors (e.g., weather conditions fully accounted for)
If the commander or operator had conducted a thorough internal safety review addressing the deviation
If further investigation clarified the context and ruled out other causes

outcome.reasoning_summary: The evidence shows a procedural deviation occurred (aircraft undershot runway and damaged a light) and that the commander was unaware and did not report it (H1, H3, H4, S3). The event was classified as a serious incident (H2). However, there is no direct evidence that the procedural deviation withstands potential defeaters; rather, the lack of reporting and incomplete information suggest vulnerability to defeaters.

node.statement: The mechanical/control failure is robust against potential defeaters within the Short_Bros_SD3-60_N915GD_10-25:hist_t3_prefinal context.

defeaters: Direct evidence of mechanical or control system failure or its resistance to defeaters
Detailed investigation or analysis ruling out environmental or pilot factors
Additional pilot or maintenance data indicating mechanical issues

Thus, the mechanical/control failure's robustness against defeaters is not supported.

children_spec.statement: Relevant environmental data (e.g., weather, lighting) was available for the time of the incident
children_spec.test_procedure: Check if weather and lighting reports or recordings exist for the incident time; absence or incompleteness lowers probability

children_spec.statement: Marking information (e.g., signage, runway markings) was documented and accessible
children_spec.test_procedure: Verify presence of official marking documentation or photographs; lack thereof reduces confidence

children_spec.statement: Environmental and marking data were retrievable and usable for analysis
children_spec.test_procedure: Attempt to retrieve and interpret environmental and marking data; failure to do so indicates deficiency

node.statement: Marking information (e.g., signage, runway markings) was documented and accessible

defeaters: If evidence showed presence of documented and accessible marking information at the airfield.
outcome.reasoning_summary: No evidence in the provided items indicates that marking information such as signage or runway markings was documented and accessible.

node.statement: Environmental and marking data were retrievable and usable for analysis

defeaters: If evidence showed data was corrupted, incomplete, or unusable for analysis
If no physical or recorded data on environmental or marking conditions were available

quotes.exact_quote: During an airfield inspection at TUPJ, which began at 1900 hrs Z on 6 November, it was found that a frangible light at the western edge of the Rwy 07 undershoot was missing.
The airfield operations team later found a frangible runway light had been damaged by the aircraft when it undershot the runway.

While he knew the aircraft initially touched down in the undershoot, the commander was unaware that it had struck the light and did not file an occurrence report.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Direct evidence (H1, S2) confirms environmental and marking data (frangible light) were retrievable and usable for analysis; maintenance findings (H11) and commander statements (S3) further support data availability and usability.

children_spec.statement: Crew members are physically present and accessible during critical communication periods
children_spec.test_procedure: Check crew attendance logs and verify presence during communication events; absence or inaccessibility would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Communication devices and channels are operational and available for use by the crew
children_spec.test_procedure: Test communication equipment functionality and channel availability; device failure or channel unavailability would lower probability

children_spec.statement: Crew members have sufficient time and opportunity to engage in communication and coordination
children_spec.test_procedure: Review task schedules and workload to determine if crew had time to communicate; excessive workload or time constraints would lower probability
